Text saved: In the past, many bridges were made of wood.
Wood can catch fire easily.
This was a big problem for old train bridges.
Trains have steel wheels and the tracks are also steel.
When the steel wheels moved on the tracks, they sometimes made a spark.
A spark is a very small, hot piece of fire.
This spark could start a fire on the wood bridge.
Then the whole bridge could burn down.
